info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 11:23PM CDT until April 04 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN ELLIS COUNTY... At 1123 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Midlothian, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Glenn Heights and Oak Leaf around 1130 PM CDT. Red Oak around 1135 PM CDT. Ennis around 1140 PM CDT. Palmer around 1145 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Pecan Hill. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
